key_risks: Market share loss and competitive pressures from AMD, NVIDIA, and ARM-based processors
Delays in transitioning to advanced process nodes (e.g., 7nm, 5nm)
Supply chain disruptions and geopolitical tensions
Regulatory and legal issues, including antitrust investigations and lawsuits
Execution risks associated with IDM 2.0 strategy and foundry services expansion
controversies: Antitrust investigations and lawsuits in the U.S. and EU
Environmental violations and criticisms over chip manufacturing impact
Labor practices and supply chain violations
social_issues: Labor practices and supply chain violations
Criticisms over human rights risks in the supply chain
governance_issues: Allegations of financial mismanagement and shareholder derivative actions

sources.title: Intel and the Environment
sources.snippet: Intel and the Environment We aspire to be a global leader in sustainability and enable partners and customers to reduce their environmental impact through our actions. Our environmental projects and company-wide initiatives are driving reductions in greenhouse gas emissions, energy use, water use, and waste generation around the world.
